questions.text: If wide range of values are present in a community then best measure of Central tendency will be?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Median is best measure of central tendency when outlier is present in data i.e wide range of values. • Mean: Most commonly used central tendency. Also it is most affected when outliers are present • Median: most commonly used when outliers are present • Mode: least affected by outliers

questions.text: In 14' century there was a disease called plague, for how many days ship and all passengers were kept under quarantine
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 40 days Quarantine term derives from “quaranta giorni,” meaning 40 days, In 14th century when plaque pandemic was devastating Europe. As a form of protection, it was declared that all ships and people had to be isolated for 40 days before entering the city.

questions.text: A pregnant lady suffered scratch and bite with a dog. What should be the next step?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) This is category III animal bite wound so local wound management, vaccine and immunoglobulins to be given. Please note: Rabies vaccine is not contraindicated in pregnancy

choices.text: Wound cleaning + Ig M + Rabies serum.

questions.text: A patient came with class 3 dog bite, previous prophylaxis for monkey bite 6 months back has been completed. What is the next step of management?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) A Class 3 dog bite (high-risk exposure) requires immediate post-exposure prophylaxis (PEP). Since the patient previously completed rabies prophylaxis (for a monkey bite 6 months ago), the management follows the booster dose schedule for previously vaccinated individuals. Rabies PEP Based on Previous Vaccination Status: 1. Previously Vaccinated (completed full PEP within the last 6 months to 3 years): Wound cleaning with soap and water. Booster doses of rabies vaccine on days 0 and 3 (0,3 schedule). Rabies immunoglobulin (RIG) is NOT needed. 2. Not Previously Vaccinated or Incomplete PEP: Wound cleaning. Full rabies vaccination schedule (0, 3, 7, 14, ± 28 days as per WHO guidelines). Rabies Immunoglobulin (RIG) administration for Class 3 exposure. Why Not the Other Options? A. Wound cleaning + Ig M + Rabies serum: Incorrect—Rabies immunoglobulin (RIG) is not needed for previously vaccinated individuals. C. Wound cleaning + rabies 0,3,7: Incorrect—A full 3-dose series is not required for a previously vaccinated patient. D. None of the above: Incorrect—Booster doses are needed in this case.

questions.text: 2nd trimester pregnant woman having 2-year-old child, recommended dose for this pregnant woman?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) dT booster. A pregnant woman who has a 2-year-old child is presumed to have received a primary series of tetanus vaccinations previously, likely during her last pregnancy. Therefore, she does not need a new primary schedule and instead requires only a single booster dose to maintain immunity. Current guidelines recommend using the Td (or dT) vaccine, which contains a reduced dose of diphtheria toxoid, rather than the tetanus-only (TT) vaccine. This ensures updated protection against both tetanus and diphtheria, making "dT booster" the most appropriate choice.

questions.text: The urban area of Delhi has 4000 population with different religions. Research is being done to study the dietary habits of the population. Which of the following techniques can be used to obtain a study sample?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Stratified random sampling In stratified random sampling, the population is first divided into homogenous groups or strata which in this case would be religion. Random samples are drawn from each stratum such that the sample represents the population from all strata.

questions.text: A surveyor visits a household consisting of a 35 year old man, his wife who is 6 weeks pregnant and a 3 year old child. The man’s brother along with his wife is currently visiting them for a month owing to winter vacation. What type of family would the surveyor classify the household?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Explanation: The household includes the nuclear family unit of the 35-year-old man, his pregnant wife, and their 3-year-old child. Additionally, the man's brother and his wife are currently residing with them for a month. This inclusion of relatives beyond the immediate nuclear family constitutes an extended family structure. Incorrect Options: Option (A) Joint family Explanation: A joint family typically involves multiple married couples from the same lineage living together permanently, often sharing resources and property. The scenario describes a temporary visit by the brother and his wife, not necessarily a permanent co-residence within a joint family system. Option (B) Nuclear family Explanation: A nuclear family consists solely of a couple and their dependent children. The presence of the man's brother and his wife expands the household beyond this basic nuclear unit. Option (D) Third generation family Explanation: A third-generation family includes grandparents, parents, and children living together. The household described only contains two generations: the 35-year-old man's generation (including his wife and brother) and his child's generation. There is no mention of grandparents residing in the household.

questions.text: Confidentiality is maintained in which of the following conditions?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Counselling Confidentiality is the state of being private- maintaining the patient’s privacy by restricting access to personal and confidential information. It is always implied between the doctor and his patient. An example of this is counselling individuals with HIV/AIDs.

questions.text: An 8 weeks pregnant woman, working in an industry consults a doctor. According to the ESI act, what is the duration of maternity leave that she can get?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) 26 weeks, starting from 8 weeks before delivery According to the ESI act, pregnant ladies can receive benefits in cash for confinement/miscarriage or sickness arising out of the same or premature birth of a child or miscarriage. This includes maternity leave for • 26 weeks of which not more than 8 weeks shall be preceding the expected date of delivery • 6 weeks in case of miscarriage • 30 days for sickness arising out of pregnancy • Women having 2 or more children shall be allowed maternity leave of 12 weeks of which not more than 6 weeks should be before the expected date of her delivery.

questions.text: Which of the following is a first-line antitubercular drug prescribed in the initial 2 months of treatment?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Ethambutol The first line antitubercular drug prescribed in the initial 2 months of treatment among the following is ethambutol. All newly diagnosed cases are treated for a total duration of 6 months given in 2 phases. This includes 2 months of intensive phase and 4 months of continuation phase. Intensive phase- 8 weeks of isoniazid, Rifampicin, Pyrazinamide, and Ethambutol. Continuation phase- 16 weeks of isoniazid, rifampicin and ethambutol.

choices.text: Aerobic during day, anaerobic during night
Anaerobic during day, aerobic during night

questions.text: The process in the oxidation pond is-
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Aerobic during day, anaerobic during night An oxidation pond is aerobic during sunshine hours of day, and anaerobic during night. An oxidation pond is a method of sewage disposal that is used to treat both sewage and industrial waste. It is an open, shallow pool of around 1-1.5m depth with an inlet and outlet. It requires algae, certain types of saprophytic bacteria and sunlight.

questions.text: Which of the following is true regarding single exposure point source epidemic?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Explosive in nature Single exposure point source epidemics occur due to a brief and simultaneous exposure to an agent. It has the finally characteristics: • It has a single peak with no secondary waves • The epidemic tends to be explosive, there is a clustering of cases within a narrow interval of time • The epidemic curve has a sharp, rapid rise and fall as all cases are clustered within one incubation period.

questions.text: Sickness absenteeism of workers in the industry is used to evaluate-

questions.text: A 12 year girl not going to school / college is having Hb of 9gm%. Her further management will be done under which scheme/program
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) RBSK (Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram). Here is a breakdown of why this is the correct choice: RBSK (Rashtriya Bal Swasthya Karyakram): This program is designed to provide comprehensive health screening and early intervention services for children from birth to 18 years of age. It covers a wide range of conditions, including deficiencies like anemia. Critically, while it primarily screens children in government schools and anganwadis, its mandate extends to all children up to 18 years, making it the most suitable program for an anemic 12-year-old girl, regardless of her school enrollment status. Mid-day meal (A): This program provides food to children who are actively attending government and government-aided schools. Since the girl is not going to school, she is ineligible for this scheme. School health (C): This program is implemented directly within the school environment for enrolled students. As the girl is not in school, this program would not cover her. ICDS (Integrated Child Development Services) (D): This scheme focuses on children up to the age of 6 years and pregnant and lactating mothers. A 12-year-old girl falls outside the primary age group for this program.

questions.text: A 32 year male presented to emergency ward following crush injury of hand. He had received last TT injection at age of 25 yrs. Wound cleaning is already done. What is next management
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Crush injuries are classified as unclean wound and last TT was given 5 years back. So now one TT dose required. So correct answer is A

questions.text: Anthrax is which category bioterrorism
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Anthrax is category A bioterrorism

choices.text: Yellow- stable, wait for some time

questions.text: which of the following is correctly match for triage category
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Red: emergency Yellow: not immediate can wait for sometime Green: walking wounded Black: dead

questions.text: A chronic alcoholic patient presents with loss of coordination, confusion and unsteady gait. Which vitamin deficiency is most likely responsible for this condition
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Vitamin B1 deficiency is seen in chronic alcoholics. It causes wernickes encephalopathy.

questions.text: While doing calculation last number was written as 93 in place of 39, correct statement is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) in place of 39, 93 was written. This will increase mean and median will remain same.

questions.text: Which of following is indirect cause of Maternal Mortality
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Most common direct cause of Maternal Mortality: PPH Most common indirect cause of Maternal Mortality: Anaemia

questions.text: Prophylactic dose of vitamin A in 1 to 6 year old child
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Prophylactic dose of vitamin A in <1 year old child is 1ml IU 6 monthly Prophylactic dose of vitamin A in 1 to 6 year old child is 2ml IU 6 monthly

questions.text: Criteria for Mid Upper Arm Circumference in shakirs tape for severe acute malnutrition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Mid Upper Arm Circumference <11.5 cm in shakirs tape is for severe acute malnutrition.

questions.text: Which of the following deficiency is associated with diarrhoea, dermatitis, alopecia and poor wound healing?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Zinc deficiency is associated with diarrhoea, dermatitis, alopecia and poor wound healing

questions.text: Which system involved in this condition?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Lymphatics

questions.text: A child presenting to clinic with H/O cough, coryza, conjunctivitis and fever. on examination rash is seen which arises behind ear and spreading all over chest , back and abdomen. What is diagnosis
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Measles rash starts behind ear. Koplik spot is pathognomic of measles.

questions.text: A 3 year old with vesicular rash all over the trunk. What is the probable diagnosis?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Vesicular rash is seen in chicken pox.

questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Telephone based

questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Stage 1 and 2

questions.text: A pregnant woman came to your OPD for ANC visit. Under anemia mukt bharat which of the following you would recommend?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) 60 mg iron once a day

questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Indirect association

questions.text: In a family a person is 67 yrs old his wife is 59 yrs old, their son is 30 yrs old and son's wife is 27 yrs old and they have a grandchild who is 5 yrs old. Calculate dependency ratio of the family.
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) 66%

questions.text: CBR is given 19 and CDR is 6. find annual growth rate?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Annual Growth Rate = (CBR - CDR) Given: CBR = 19 CDR = 6 Calculation: Growth Rate (per 1,000) = 19?6=13 To convert this rate to a percentage, divide by 10: Annual Growth Rate (%) = 13/10 =1.3%

questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Lippes loop

questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Sanguinarine

questions.text: In a normal distribution, mean value is 82, SD is 1.5. Calculate 95% population?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Mean = 82 Standard Deviation = 1.5 The calculation for the 95% range is as follows: Lower end of the range = 82?(2×1.5)=82?3=79 Upper end of the range = 82+(2×1.5)=82+3=85 Therefore, 95% of the population falls between 79 and 85.

questions.solution: Correct Answer (B)

questions.solution: Correct Answer (C)

questions.text: A study was done on factory workers of aniline dye factory. One group included people who work with dye and another group is clerical staff of that factory. All the details were obtained from the records of past 20 years. Which study is this?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Groups are made based on past exposure (dye workers vs. clerical staff), and data is taken from records of the past 20 years so it's a cohort study using old records, hence retrospective.

questions.text: A cotton swab cleaned pus and maggots on a patient. This should be discarded in?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Used cotton with pus and maggots is infectious waste.Yellow bag is for human tissues, body fluids, dressings, cotton, etc.Non-chlorinated because it's safe for incineration. So, it goes in the yellow non-chlorinated bag.

questions.text: A person is moving from Nigeria to USA. He is advised to have vaccine certificate which is valid. Which certificate he should take?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) 17D is the Yellow Fever vaccine.It is mandatory for international travel from Yellow Fever endemic countries like Nigeria.Travelers must carry a valid Yellow Fever vaccination certificate when entering countries such as the USA. OKA is for varicella, and Edmonston-Zagreb is for measles not relevant here.

questions.text: An ANM opens 2 vaccine vials, one is penta and MR. After session is done, which one to discard?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) MR Pentavalent is a liquid vaccine and follows Open Vial Policy. MR (Measles-Rubella) is a lyophilized (powder) vaccine. Once reconstituted, it must be discarded within 4 hours. So after the session: MR must be discarded, Penta can be reused

questions.text: A mother brought her child to OPD, she is worried about no scar after BCG o her baby. Wat you advise?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) BCG scar is expected but not essential for protection. Even without a scar, the vaccine may still be effective. No need to repeat the dose just because scar is absent. So Reassure the mother.

questions.text: In family cycle which phase is from birth of last child to first child leaving home?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) Complete Extension: From birth of the last child to first child leaving home.

questions.text: A factory woker met an accident while working and got 40% burn with complication. Which benefit he is entitled for?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) Under ESI (Employees’ State Insurance) Act: Extended Sickness Benefit is provided for certain long-term diseases. Burns >20% with complications is one of the listed conditions under ESB. Since the worker has 40% burns with complication, he qualifies for Extended Sickness Benefit.

questions.text: One health worker noted unusual behaviour in one TB patients. Where should be connected?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) TELE-MANAS is the national mental health helpline. Nikshay is for TB treatment and tracking: not mental health. U-WIN is for immunization tracking: unrelated here.

questions.text: Study was conducted in nursing staff about patient care like vital monitoring, bed preparation. Which management technique is this?
questions.solution: Correct Answer (C) The study observes how nurses spend their time on tasks like vital monitoring, bed preparation, etc. Work Sampling is a technique to analyze time spent on different job activities through random observations. It's used to improve work efficiency and resource allocation.

questions.text: Mean is 100 and SD is 15, find value in 95% range
questions.solution: Correct Answer (A) In a normal distribution: 95% values lie within ±2 SD from the mean Mean = 100, SD = 15 2 SD = 2 × 15 = 30 So, 95% range = 100 ± 30 = 70 to 130

questions.text: A study was done to investigate mean blood pressure in 2 pregnant women group. Test is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (D) Comparing mean blood pressure between two different groups of pregnant women So, we use Unpaired T-test to compare their means

questions.text: A group of experts presenting their speech one by one, no one discusses in between. This is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) In a symposium, experts speak one after another on the same topic No interaction or discussion happens during the presentations Why not Panel discussion? Because its Interactive, with cross-questions among panelists

questions.text: Child eating paint is at risk of developing
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) A child eating or chewing on paint chips can absorb lead, leading to lead poisoning. This can affect the nervous system, cause anemia, and developmental delays.

questions.text: People after eating bajra developed nausea. This is
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) Bajra (pearl millet) can get contaminated with ergot fungus (Claviceps fusiformis) This produces toxins that cause symptoms like nausea, vomiting, giddiness, and even hallucinations or convulsions

questions.text: People developing paralysis and walking using one stick in a village mainly consume dal, this can be prevented by
questions.solution: Correct Answer (B) The condition described is Neurolathyrism, caused by excessive consumption of Lathyrus sativus (khesari dal). Neurolathyrism leads to spastic paralysis of lower limbs, and people often walk with the help of a stick. Vitamin C can prevent this condition
